objectsettings.description: A set of concepts, optionally including statements about semantic relationships between those concepts. Thesauri, classification schemes, subject heading lists, taxonomies, 'folksonomies', and other types of controlled vocabulary are all examples of concept schemes. Concept schemes are also embedded in glossaries and terminologies.
An idea or notion; a unit of thought.

advancedSettings.relationDescription: Preferred Label. The property skosxl:prefLabel is used to associate an skosxl:Label with a skos:Concept. The property is analogous to skos:prefLabel.

relations.relationDescription: Preferred Label. The property skosxl:prefLabel is used to associate an skosxl:Label with a skos:Concept. The property is analogous to skos:prefLabel.

advancedSettings.relationDescription: Alternative Label. The property skosxl:altLabel is used to associate an skosxl:Label with a skos:Concept. The property is analogous to skos:altLabel.

relations.relationDescription: Alternative Label. The property skosxl:altLabel is used to associate an skosxl:Label with a skos:Concept. The property is analogous to skos:altLabel.

advancedSettings.relationDescription: Hidden Label. The property skosxl:hiddenLabel is used to associate an skosxl:Label with a skos:Concept. The property is analogous to skos:hiddenLabel.

relations.relationDescription: Hidden Label. The property skosxl:hiddenLabel is used to associate an skosxl:Label with a skos:Concept. The property is analogous to skos:hiddenLabel.

objectsettings.description: A special class of lexical entities.

properties.propertyDescription: The value of the label. Combined with the language it represents the literal form of the label.
An ordered collection of concepts, where both the grouping and the ordering are meaningful.

objectsettings.description: A hidden lexical label, represented by means of the skos:hiddenLabel property, is a lexical label for a resource, where a KOS designer would like that character string to be accessible to applications performing text-based indexing and search operations, but would not like that label to be visible otherwise. Hidden labels may for instance be used to include misspelled variants of other lexical labels.
An abstract relation type denoting the relation between two things.

Notes are used to provide information relating to SKOS concepts. There is no restriction on the nature of this information, e.g., it could be plain text, hypertext, or an image; it could be a definition, information about the scope of a concept, editorial information, or any other type of information.

properties.propertyDescription: One of note, changeNote, definition, editorialNote, example, historyNote, or scopeNote

backendModules.description: A module to create and edit taxonomies.
backendModules.name: Taxonomy Administration

properties.description: This extension enables you to build a complex taxonomy based on the SKOS meta model. SKOS is a w3c recommendation and thus a reliable industry standard for describing concepts.
properties.name: Taxonomy
